utterance.speaker: DOORMAN
utterance.content: All right, guys! Keep it clear! Don’t you have anything better to do?

utterance.speaker: HARVEY STRYKER
utterance.content: Mandy! Mandy! Have you talked to Zach since the breakup?

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Do you regret cheating on him? Is there any truth to the rumor that you’re going back into rehab?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Hum?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Should I be worried about your commitment to our engagement?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because it says right here you’re getting back together with your ex-wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right here. Page Six.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Castle caught cuddling with ex-wife publisher.” No, no. This was a business lunch. We were discussing Heat and Storm books.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so … um … you weren’t “gazing lovingly into her eyes”?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She has spinach in her teeth. That’s just – okay – I don’t – See, this wouldn’t happen if you’d just let me announce our engagement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We already talked about this. Everybody that’s important to us already knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and just because I’m a public figure doesn’t mean you need to be one, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, so long as you don’t mind this sort of thing happening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t. ‘cause it’s not true. And it only gives me more material to torture you with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm… and the student becomes the master.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who rings the doorbell at 6:45 in the morning?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Hey, Mr. C! Hope I didn’t wake you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: I was just on my way to work, thought I would pick up my letter of recommendation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. For your grant, uh, application.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Really appreciate you doing it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know I told Alexis I was finished, but I haven’t really quite, um … I’m still tweaking it. Getting it just right.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: You’re a perfectionist. Like me. Well, take your time. Not too much time. The deadline’s tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll have it done by lunch.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Thanks, Mr. C! You’re the best!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, Pi.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You haven’t written a word, have you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But in my defense, what am I supposed to write? It’s Pi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why’d you offer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t. Alexis asked and … I can’t say no. But no more excuses. I’m going to do it right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless that’s a murder.

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: This is Harvey Stryker with CelebGazer.com. We’re getting unconfirmed reports that pop diva Mandy Sutton is dead at 22.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mandy Sutton? Oh no. Alexis used to love her kid’s show, Mandy Melody. She was a regular teen by day and a crime fighting pop star by night and nobody recognized her at school because she wore glasses.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well it looks like she could have used that trick in real life. I mean, look at this. No wonder she was such a mess.

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Detective! Can you confirm for us that Mandy Sutton’s dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – you know –

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Can you give us details on how she died?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have work to do. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: HARVEY
utterance.content: Oh hey, Richard Castle. Is it true that you’re getting back together with your ex-wife?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This isn’t about me today.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Castle, how come you didn’t deny it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean, back there? Are you kidding? Yeah, if I deny that then they think it’s true. I thought that stuff doesn’t bother you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It doesn’t. Hey. So Mandy Sutton lived in this building?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Penthouse. Doorman found her just before six this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OD?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Given her lifestyle, you’d think. But this is plain old fashioned murder. Blunt force trauma to the back of the head. The facial lacerations probably happened with the fall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, when did this happen?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Lividity puts it between nine and eleven last night.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER
utterance.content: Well, we can cut that time frame in half. The doorman said that the limo dropped her off at the lobby last night at 10PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was killed within an hour of returning home?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was she doing back here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Doorman didn’t know, but he said that she uses that door sometimes when she wants to avoid the crowd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … maybe she was sneaking out or meeting someone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If so, it’s probably someone she knew. Gates are locked on both sides. You need an access code to get tin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there any security cam footage we can pull?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not back here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ironic, seeing as how she spent her entire life in front of cameras.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paparazzi was out front last night. Let’s see if we can get copies of their photos. Whoever was behind this might have been in that crowd. And no talking to the press. Not until we know what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: KELLY JANE
utterance.content: Where is she? Oh my God, Mandy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ma’am –

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: Mandy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ma’am, this is a crime scene. You can’t be back here.

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: You don’t understand. I’m her personal assistant.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You still can’t be back here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But we will need to take you to the station to get a statement. Do you have contact information for her next of kin?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: That would be her – her manager. I mean, her mother.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN SUTTON
utterance.content: How could this happen? What was she even doing in that alley?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know of anyone who would have wanted to harm your daughter?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Yeah. A lot of people dislike her, who she became. Provocative clothes and dancing. They just wanted her to be Mandy Melody forever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Had she received any threats recently?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: Sure she’d get some disturbing letters, but any that were too aggressive we’d turn over to the security firm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’re going to need to see all of those letters. Now, do you know if she was planning on meeting with anyone at her apartment last night?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: We hadn’t spoken to her in two days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was missing?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: No. We knew where she was.

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: It wasn’t hard to track her on the social media and gossip sites. She was partying pretty hard.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: But the last few months, Mandy had been doing pretty great. She’d stayed clean since her last stint in rehab. She even met a guy while she was doing her community service. Zach. He builds houses for the poor. And then a couple nights ago she went to a club for someone’s birthday and … She got drunk and she started making out with an old boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: And someone took a picture. It hit all the gossip sites. When Zach saw …

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: It was too much for him. They got into a big fight and he left her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How long had they been dating?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Four months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means he would know how to access the alley behind your daughter’s building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where we could find him?

utterance.speaker: ZACH BENTON
utterance.content: It’s funny, the last time I saw this picture I didn’t think I could feel any worse, but now that she’s gone –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? Exactly how bad did you feel?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: Look, I loved her. I would never hurt her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then you wouldn’t mind us asking where you were between ten and eleven last night.

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: I – I didn’t do this, okay? I was at a lumber yard in Fairfield, New Jersey loading up a truck with the rest of these guys. You can – you can ask them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And the last time you saw her?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: Two days ago when I broke it off. Why are you asking me these questions? I’m not the one with the attempted manslaughter charges.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Manslaughter charge?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: Yeah, her ex-boyfriend, Jesse Jones. The one in that picture? He’s the one who got her into drugs in the first place. Mandy never told anyone this, but the last time they broke up he threatened to kill her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Weapons charges, aggravated assault. That’s a hell of a resume, Jesse. How does someone like you hook up with a superstar like Mandy?

utterance.speaker: JESSE JONES
utterance.content: Like all the other pretty little rich girls that come to me for their ink. She was looking for a lot more than a tattoo and I was happy to provide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I read online that the two of you were stormy and it didn’t end well. You trashed her apartment and made some pretty serious threats.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Water under the bridge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Until two nights ago when you guys hooked up. How did that happen?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: I was at a bar. She came in, threw herself at me like old times, and I obliged. That was the last time I saw her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’d you take it? When right after that photo of you two appeared she told Celeb Gazer that you were – “human trash” and that “that night was the biggest mistake of her life”.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: She seemed to like it okay at the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between ten and eleven?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: I was at a pool hall in Queens with some friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Names.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We … have a little problem here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what the problem is. That’s not my daughter. That’s not Mandy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Mandy’s mom identified our victim as Claire Samuels, 25. She was an aspiring actress.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Mandy’s decoy.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Decoy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, to fool the press. It’s a practice not uncommon in this age of stalker-azzi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she’d dress up as Mandy, she’d put on sunglasses, she’d let the hordes follow her so that Mandy could go about unnoticed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now, we’ve notified Claire’s parents. They’re flying in. And ESPOSITO’s digging into her life as we speak.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So if Claire is our actual victim, then where is Mandy Sutton?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know. No one has seen her and she’s not answering her phone.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Given that Claire was pretending to be Mandy when she was killed, then we need to consider the very real possibility that Mandy Sutton was our killer’s intended target. And that they might be looking to finish the job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They may already have, which is why we can’t find her.

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: Found her. She’s checked into the Wessex Hotel under one of her aliases. But she’s not answering her room phone and she’s not responding to knocks on the door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not blood. It’s wine.

utterance.speaker: MANDY SUTTON
utterance.content: Closing time already?

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: What do you mean, I’m dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Claire Samuels was killed last night and the world think that that was you.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Claire Samuels. She’s your decoy.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: The girl we dressed to look like you, to confuse the paparazzi.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Oh. Oh. Yeah. That’s pretty harsh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know why she went to your apartment last night?

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I mean, we’re trying to figure out how she got there, and your mom said that she wasn’t scheduled to work yesterday, so …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, the limo company claims the car she arrived in was ordered by you.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: I’ve never drunk dialed a limo before, but – - nope. Wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Claire? Did you call her?

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: No. I barely know her.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: We discouraged personal contact. It wouldn’t make much sense to have a decoy if they’re going to be seen hanging out together.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Can I lay down now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, Miss Sutton, we have a couple more questions for you about your life.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: My life?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. We think you may have been the intended target.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah. That does make more sense. Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So um, do you know if anyone would have wanted to hurt you? Do you have any enemies?

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: The press. But they wouldn’t hurt me. Without me who would they write all those bad things about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, the last two days when you were out socializing did you have any fights or did you upset anyone?

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Probably. I’m a little hazy on the details.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Is that it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. For now. In the meantime, you should probably go back to the hotel and lay low in your room.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Shouldn’t we make an announcement? Let everyone know that she isn’t dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you know, if someone was trying to kill her, it may be safer to let them assume they’ve actually succeeded while we’re still doing our job.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: How long? She starts a tour next week, and as her manager I can’t imagine that it’s going to help ticket sales if everyone thinks she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Yep, wouldn’t want to screw up the big comeback tour.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Sweetie, you’ve worked really hard on those new songs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve talking about staying out of sight for a day. Maybe less. Hopefully by then we’ll have a lead to help us figure out who’s behind this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, Beckett? I might have an idea about that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found this anonymous letter in your fan mail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “I’m watching you and I don’t like what I see.”

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Yeah well, get in line. Guys, look around. I get letter form creepizoids all the time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But in addition to the letter he also included this.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Oh my God. That’s my bedroom. While I was sleeping.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Your building is supposed to be secure. How did he get in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s inkjet paper.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we might be able to track it.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Most people don’t know this, but the serial number of the printer that was used to make these photographs is actually embedded into the picture.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s printed in tiny little yellow dots invisible to the naked eye. It’s an FBI thing used to track counterfeiters.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Okay. I don’t feel so hot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I – I think someone needs a cup of coffee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Here is your four shot latte. How’re you feeling?

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Considering I’m supposed to be dead – – about right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: I just can’t believe that freak was actually in my bedroom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we’ll find him. I know how tough it can be. The crazy fans, the constant scrutiny, the pressure of living your life under a microscope. I mean, I can relate. On a smaller scale, of course, but still, it’s …

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: And … who are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On a much smaller scale.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad! There you are!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis? What are you doing here? Oh, the letter! For Pi! I – I just – I’m about to – just going to make a few tweaks –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You haven’t written it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not all – not yet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I thought you might need some help, so I came up with some talking points for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, good. Okay, um … “outstanding person, a natural leader” –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I know you and Pi don’t always see eye to eye. If you don’t feel comfortable doing this –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, listen. Hey – – hey, Pi and I see eye to eye on one every important, redheaded thing, okay? Love you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I love you, too. Hey, can you believe that about Mandy Sutton? It’s weird, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, weird.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You remember how much I loved her show? And those secret identity glasses? If you were mad at me I’d wear a pair of glasses to dinner and you’d pretend you didn’t know who I was?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I remember. Actually –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But then she grew up and, whoa. I mean, how does that happen? How does someone become such a hot mess?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh my God. I thought you were –

utterance.speaker: MANDY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, this is Mandy. We’re just, uh, keeping her under wraps. For now. This is my daughter.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Dad. It’s not true. Yes, I know what they wrote. We’re still engaged. What do you mean Aunt Theresa put it on her Facebook? Well tell her – tell her to take it down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I gotta go. I love you. Bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Espo? Do you believe everything that they write in the newspapers?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh. Hell no. I mean, except for that thing between Castle and his ex-wife. I mean, that’s …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you find anything on Claire?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I did. I went into the phone records of that limo company. Turns out that Claire was the one that ordered that limo last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would Claire order a limo to take her to Mandy’s place?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know, but I just got off the phone with Claire’s roommate. She said Claire’s been going through some things in the last couple of days. She’s been upset, crying.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Those photos of Mandy in her bedroom? I traced the printer’s serial number to an electronics store in Midtown. According to the extended warranty it belongs to a Ken Castor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he’s done time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: For aggravated assault. And then two years ago he was hit with a restraining order for stalking … Mandy Sutton.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Old habits die hard.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And those paparazzi photos from the night that she was killed? I went through them. Look who was right there when Claire stepped out

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Police!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kitchen, clear. Bedroom?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear. Hey. Closet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think we got our guy.

utterance.speaker: KEN CASTOR
utterance.content: No, listen. You don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The hell we don’t. We know you took those pictures, Ken. And we know that you were in her apartment.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: Because she needed me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Needed you?

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: I was protecting her. I was watching over her and she – she needed that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right. Because she didn’t have people watching her, staring at her already.

utterance.speaker: KEN
utterance.content: They didn’t care! Not like me. They don’t understand her. I mean, they drove her to it, you know? That’s why I sent her the pictures. Because she needed to know someone cared. She – she needed to know someone was watching.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that what you were doing outside of her apartment last night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Watching?
